Malaria.Name: P. falciparum uncomplicated
Malaria.Details:
Uncomplicated malria and able to retain tablets.
Admit Medically
Malaria.Treatment:
1.    Quinine sulphate 600mg tds po x 7 days Plus Doxycycline 100mg bd po x 7 days (or Clindamycin 20mg/kg i 3 dividing doses po x 7 days)

OR

2.     Proguanil-Atovaquone (Malarone) 100mg/250mg : 4 tablets od po x 3 days

OR

3.     Artemether-Lumefantrine (Riamet or Coartem)- 20mg/120mg: 4 tablets at 0h, 8h, 24h, 36h, 48h, 60h

Malaria.Name: P. falciparum severe
Malaria.Treatment:
• IVQuinine (loadingdose)20mg/kg(uptomax1.4g) (dilutionin0.9%NormalSaline) over 4 hours infusion, followed by maintenance dose 8 hours after start of loading dose with 10mg/kg (up to max 700mg) over 4 hours infusion, TDS (Loading dose should not be given if patient has taken oral quinine/mefloquine/ quinidine within the preceding 12 hours). Contact Consultant Microbiologist if patient unable to take quinine

PLUS
•    Doxycycline 100mg bd po (or Clindamycin 20mg/kg in 3 dividing doses po), if no contraindication *Consult microbiology/pharmacy if oral route not feasible

Switch iv quinine to oral therapy (Quinine sulphate 600mg tds) once patient is able to tolerate oral medication and improving.

Duration; 7 days

Malaria.Name: P. vivax Chloroquine-sensitive
Malaria.Details: Allow discharge in uncomplicated cases, follow up in 2 weeks
Malaria.Treatment:
Chloroquine 600mg at 0hr, then 300mg at 6hr, 24hr and 48hr Followed by Primaquine* 15mg od or 30mg od po x 14 days.
* Essential to Screen for G6PD deficiency

Malaria.Name: P. vivax Chloroquine-resistant
Malaria.Details: Allow discharge in uncomplicated cases, follow up in 2 weeks
Malaria.Treatment:
1.    Quinine Sulphate 600mg tid po x 7 days + Doxycycline 100mg bd po x 7 days

OR

2.   Proguanil-Atovaquone (Malarone) 100mg/250mg : 4 tablets od po x 3 days

Followed by Primaquine*15mg od or 30mg od po x 14 days AFTER completion of above course
* Essential to Screen for G6PD deficiency
